alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 8:24PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Kittson, Walsh, Marshall and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Marshall, Grand Forks, Polk and Walsh Counties. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Traill and Norman Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Grand Forks and Polk Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. .Snowmelt river flooding to continue. Rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to rate of ongoing snowmelt runoff and rain, snow, and colder temperatures in the forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Wahpeton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Storm sewer valves are closed and interior pumping begins (Breckenridge). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CDT Thursday was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...Expect stages to remain above flood stage for some time. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
